panoptes.mount package¶

Submodules¶

class panoptes.mount.ioptron.Mount(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

iOptron mounts

iOptron init procedure:

logger = <panoptes.utils.logger.Logger object at 0x2adb9ed95be0>¶

panoptes.mount.mount module¶

class panoptes.mount.mount.AbstractMount(config={}, commands={}, site=None, init=False)[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Abstract Base class for controlling a mount

Methods to be implemented:
  • check_coordinates
  • sync_coordinates
  • slew_to_coordinates
  • slew_to_park
  • echo
check_coordinates()[source]¶

Query the mount for the current position of the mount. This will be useful in comparing the position of the mount to the orientation indicated by the accelerometer or by an astrometric plate solve.

connect()[source]¶

Connects to the mount via the serial port (self.port). Opens a serial connection and calls initialize_mount

echo()[source]¶

mount-specific echo command

initialize_mount()[source]¶
is_slewing[source]¶

Class property that determines if mount is slewing. For some mounts, this is a built in function. For mount which do not have it we will have to write something based on how the coordinates are changing.

logger = <panoptes.utils.logger.Logger object at 0x2adb9ed95630>¶
ping()[source]¶

Attempts to ping the mount. Can be implemented in various ways

serial_query(cmd, params='')[source]¶

Performs a send and then returns response. Will do a translate on cmd first. This should be the major serial utility for commands.

serial_read()[source]¶

Reads from the serial connection.

serial_write(string_command)[source]¶

Sends a string command to the mount via the serial port. First ‘translates’ the message into the form specific mount can understand

setup_commands(commands)[source]¶

Does any setup for the commands needed for this mount. Mostly responsible for setting the pre- and post-commands. We could also do some basic checking here to make sure required commands are in fact available.

setup_site(site=None)[source]¶

Sets the mount up to the current site. Includes: # Latitude set_long # Longitude set_lat # Universal Time Offset set_gmt_offset # Daylight Savings disable_daylight_savings # Current Date set_local_date # Current Time set_local_time

slew_to_coordinates(ra=None, dec=None)[source]¶
Inputs:
RA and Dec RA tracking rate (in arcsec per second, use 15.0 in absence of tracking model). Dec tracking rate (in arcsec per second, use 0.0 in absence of tracking model).
slew_to_park()[source]¶

No inputs, the park position should be defined in configuration

sync_coordinates()[source]¶

Takes as input, the actual coordinates (J2000) of the mount and syncs the mount on them. Used after a plate solve. Once we have a mount model, we would use sync only initially, then subsequent plate solves would be used as input to the model.
